Name: Tombstone with Blind Person Playing a Lyre
Description: The finely made tombstone is carved in white marble. The relief on the tombstone depicts the deceased as a blind person, half nude, with a well-depicted athletic body.He is sitting on a Greek chair with a foot stool and playing his lyre. He is looking backward with his head raised upward, revealing a young face with long hair. The name of the deceased, Theophilos, is written in Greek at the top of the tombstone.
